data.title: GD can not new project in ubuntu 17.10
data.body:
My desktop is Ubuntu 17.10, 
----------------------
$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu Artful Aardvark (development branch)
Release:	17.10
Codename:	artful
--------------------
I was following the guide to complie source with CMake . 
 I run GD as following: 
 /GD/Binaries/Output/Release_Linux$ ./StartGDevelop.sh

When I new a project, 
It shows:
--------------------------
ERROR - ContextualIdentityService - Unknown version found in /home/timloo/.mozilla/firefox/wa7fp0qh.default/containers.json
Bool attribute "folderProject" not found, returning 0Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Bool attribute "updateIfNotVisible" not found, returning 1Child effects not found in SerializerElement::GetChild
The program 'GDIDE' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAccess (attempt to access private resource denied)'.
  (Details: serial 45 error_code 10 request_code 2 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)
-----------------------------------
Any Help?

Best Regards,Tim

data.title: JSON for other variable types and clear structure
data.body:
Some actions and expressions to move between variable types, you can copy a variable into another of any type in just one action, and save them in a JSON string, for example to save an object variable's status, it makes the JSON functions more relevant and less restricted. To make it more complete I've added a clear structure action, to remove all the children from a structure, there was no way to make it before. Finally a little example to show the features.

Let me know what do you think, if it's ok or no, or if something has to be modified :)

Blockly for events system

data.title: I wanna create Pause function without changing scene.
data.body:
I want to create Pause function without changing scene.
Can I create Pause function only to changing scene?

Or can I overlap two scenes?

data.title: Physics extension stops exported android app running!
data.body:
I spent a long time making this physics game, and after exporting it and then converting with phonegap, It failed to load on the app! After lots of trying I discovered that it was the physics extension which stops it from running! 

If there is a way of solving this I'd love to know!

Thanks

data.title: Admob adverts not working
data.body:
Hi there, 

Thank you so much for fixing the crash issue when adding the admob banner.
Now we have an entirely different issue. I followed the tutorial on the website installing the cordova admob plugin. I then export and test the game in my emulator and on my phone... but no adverts show.

My banner advert is set to show on startup on my second scene... but nothing shows up.
Any ideas?

data.title: Chunk Map Support for larger game worlds.
data.body:
Hey got a request for the new GDevelop IDE

What is it: Chunk Map Support

You can read more info on the subject below:
http://www.dynetisgames.com/2017/07/24/westward-dev-log-1-chunk-maps/

There is also some sample code below -
https://github.com/marcus-robinson/chunk-map/tree/master/www/js/game

So what am I asking?
1. The ability to import (.tmx?) multiple maps to make a much larger map but stream chunks in and out as needed to retain high performance.
2. A tool or Tool set to manage this much larger map.
3. Being able to define the size of the chunk maps on a per tile basis would be nice as well.

data.title: Can't install GDevelop from Fedora Repo
data.body:
I am trying to install GDevelop using the Fedora repo. I add the repo, run `sudo dnf install gdevelop` and then get the following error: 

    Error:
     Problem: conflicting requests
      - nothing provides libGLEW.so.1.13 needed by gdevelop-4.0.94-2.1.i686
      - nothing provides libGLEW.so.1.13()(64bit) needed by gdevelop-4.0.94-2.1.x86_64

I have installed `libGLEW`, `glew-devel`, and `glew`, for both the `x86_64` and the `i686` versions. I am using Fedora 26.

Using the RPM file and the `rpm -ivh` command yields similar results.

data.title: Browser support for newIDE (with preview but no export/open)
Making an active preview inaccessible.
data.body:
I somehow made the preview inaccessible. The scene (and all other) tabs become unresponsive and the user is left unable to save their project! File simply says "Please stop the preview before continuing".

Conditions to replicate:
I started editing the event sheet and it must have changed the tabs at the top. This was while a preview was still active.

![cannot access scene tab](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12471157/29820149-b0bab05c-8c80-11e7-8660-641cb00fa5d7.png)

data.title: More improvements to the English translation.
data.body:
I don't know how to exclude items in a pull request, so this also includes my changes from the previous pull request that you already merged.

All of the new ones are from August 28, so you only need to read those. Since you're in a different timezone, remember that this is the first new one: [03d4c33](https://github.com/4ian/GD/pull/376/commits/03d4c3319edb641be750a4aae04a6070e4565cf1)

Can you decide to exclude commits when you squash them? Next time, I'll avoid this problem.

data.title: libwx_gtk2u_html erro?
data.body:
Hello, 

OpenSuse 42.3 erro with Gdevelop...

`Unable to launch GDevelop, a unknown error happened! Here is the full error message: 
 ./GDIDE: relocation error: ./libGDCore.so: symbol _ZThn664_N13wxHtmlListBox10RefreshAllEv, version WXU_3.0 not defined in file libwx_gtk2u_html-suse.so.3 with link time reference
`

Gnome-Terminal:

`linux@linux-a02n:~> gdevelop
./GDIDE: relocation error: ./libGDCore.so: symbol _ZThn664_N13wxHtmlListBox10RefreshAllEv, version WXU_3.0 not defined in file libwx_gtk2u_html-suse.so.3 with link time reference
Gtk-Message: GtkDialog mapped without a transient parent. This is discouraged.
`

data.title: howler-sound-manager: pause/resume sounds when Cordova app is being paused/resumed
data.body: Without it, sounds in Cordova packaged games keep playing on Android when the app is suspended by the user (by switching the app or pressing home screen).

data.title: Events editor for newIDE
data.body:
This is the events editor for newIDE. It's designed from scratch, with support for inline-editing of parameters and events, drag'n'drop, sub conditions edition (without crash! :)).

Things to do:
- [ ] Undo/redo
- [x] Copy/Paste of events
- [x] Copy/Paste of instructions
- [ ] Drag'n'drop of instructions?
- [ ] Add fields for all kind of parameters
- [ ] Expression autocompletion

![Overview](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DGPINYIXsAAg0aW.png)

data.title: Platformer: Touch screen jump and move issues
data.body:
![touchscreen_jumps_dia](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30509771/28692550-f6d12e94-7318-11e7-8b65-299f4033c35e.png)

Hi

I am having some issues with my platformer. I am new to 'programming' but finding G dev just about manageable. (infact I am quite enjoying it)

Is it possible to programme my touch screen buttons so both 'JUMP' and 'LEFT' can be touched and my character jumps accordingly in that direction?

I know the character can do this as it worked on the keyboard controls (R_shift and left)

I have added event which I thought would make sense but it did not make any difference to the results.

Thank you!

M

data.title: Can't build GD anymore
data.body:
After the commit 6d5e4e388ff8d3f5b258aa4f723512ff4b89b0c0 my compilations fail, deleted the entire directory, cloned the repository again and still fails with errors related to undefined references to DependenciesAnalyzer functions. You moved the DependenciesAnalyzer from Cpp to Core, maybe a CMake file gets out of date?, I have no idea how cmake files work :(

EDIT: It's compiling ok in my Ubuntu, the problem is Windows

data.title: Build GDevelop on Mac
data.body:
Hello. I am trying to install Gdevelop on my mac El capitan and got "quit unexpectedly error" when launched as referenced in issue #343 . So I decided to build by my own from the provided source. 

Then I did some findings and followed these guide and download these entire required tools through homebrew  http://4ian.github.io/GD-Documentation/GDCore%20Documentation/install_mac_o_s_tools.html (noticing that the build folder should be on the **binaries** folder, not the main GD folder).

However, I got "Configuration incomplete error" when executing `cmake ../..` command **and** also got the message "Extracting SFML in ExtLibs/SFML... (can take a bit of time, be patient) CMake Error at ExtLibs/CMakeLists.txt:10 (ADD_SUBDIRECTORY): add_subdirectory given source "SFML" which is not an existing directory." (but I am sure to have installed **curl** here)-(from issue #140).

Can anyone suggest me to resolve this problem? There might be some others who may have the same issue as mine. And as always, any help would be greatly appreciated.
